title: Man shot to death outside Mt. Morris Township car wash
content:
MT. MORRIS TWP. MI - A man was shot and killed at a car wash on Pierson Road following an altercation at a nearby apartment complex on Monday, June 27.
Mt. Morris Township Police Chief Terence Green said officers responded to 911 calls at about 9:15 a.m. to Pierson Road and Pierson Place for reports of an altercation between two men.
As police were headed to the call, more 911 calls came in for reports shots fired, Green said.
When police got to Mattis Auto Wash, 3466 Pierson Place, they found a man dead in the doorway.
Green said the man is approximately 18. Police did not release his identity saying the victim's family hadn't been notified.
A man and a woman are in police custody in connection to the shooting, Green said.
The altercation started in the Suffolk Court apartments about 100 yards from the car wash, Green said. He did not say what led to the argument.
"Right now we're in the preliminary stages of the investigation," Green said. "We're not sure exactly what happened, but all involved are in custody."
The car wash was expected to be closed for at least another hour, police said.
"This is very rare for this area," Green said, adding that the victim and suspects knew each other and that it wasn't a random shooting. "The victim and the suspects arrived here in the same vehicle."
Dominic Adams is a reporter for The Flint Journal. Contact him at dadams5@mlive.com or 810-241-8803. Follow him on Twitter, Facebook or Google+.
